meanings.definition: Having a V-shaped cut or indentation
meanings.sent1: The tree had a notched trunk from where the branch had been removed.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden fence had a notched design along the top.
meanings.sent3: The notched edge of the paper made it look like a tiny staircase.
meanings.sent4: Her notched smile revealed a mischievous secret.
meanings.sent5: The notched pattern on the fabric resembled a row of tiny teeth.

meanings.definition: Marked with a series of small cuts or indentations
meanings.sent1: The notched blade of the knife made slicing through the bread easier.
meanings.sent2: The ancient stone tablet was covered in notched symbols.
meanings.sent3: The notched surface of the table made it perfect for a game of tic-tac-toe.
meanings.sent4: His notched belt showed signs of frequent use.
meanings.sent5: The notched handle of the tool provided a better grip.

meanings.definition: To make a V-shaped cut or indentation in
meanings.sent1: He carefully notched the wood before joining the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman notched the metal rod to create a secure connection.
meanings.sent3: She playfully notched her initials into the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor notched away at the marble to reveal the hidden figure.
meanings.sent5: The tailor notched the fabric to mark where the buttons would go.

meanings.definition: To score or achieve a point or goal
meanings.sent1: The team notched another victory in their winning streak.
meanings.sent2: She notched a high score in the video game after hours of practice.
meanings.sent3: He notched his first goal of the season with a powerful kick.
meanings.sent4: The singer notched a hit single with her latest release.
meanings.sent5: The student notched a perfect score on the challenging exam.
